intro: Astragalus leonidae, commonly known as the Leonidae milkvetch, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus leonidae plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators in its native range.
